description:
托福听力篇幅较长，延续时间长，以及听力内容信息量大等原因，成为很多中国考生的头疼问题。这不仅要求考生拥有较强的短暂记忆力、复述能力和快速笔记的能力，也要求考生积累大量的听力背景知识，并熟练对特点词汇进行反馈。因此，备考托福听力不简简单单需要大量的反复练习，更需要锻炼和掌握相应的托福听力技巧。

坚持以听力真题为根本

没有其他材料比真题更能真切的体现托福的出题意向和方式了。如果考生在备考的时候能够对已有的过往真题耳熟能详，对以后临场的托福听力来说，一定有着不小的帮助。切忌好高骛远，专攻“偏、难、怪”的听力篇目，这不仅可能打击考生的自信心，浪费宝贵的备考时间，也有悖于托福考试的考查点。

练习中实在听不懂可查看原文

在做托福过往的听力真题的过程中，应尽量掌握文章中常用的句型和特点词汇，增加对这些答题提示关键点的敏感度。遇到反复听不懂的情况，可能由于连读、词汇障碍。习语不明等原因。此时不必纠结其中，或可以尝试根据上下文大胆猜测、或根据语境语气推测等方式。而过后通读原文，找到症结所在即可。

词汇量贯穿其中

词汇量的多少尝尝决定着考生对听力材料的理解程度。试想，如果听力材料中有过半的单词都不认识，任凭考生有着再好的语法功底，又怎能明白听力所表述的内容呢？而材料中的特点词汇又往往是问题的答案关键词。对词汇的掌握在托福考试的任何一个部分都贯穿其中，起着至关重要的作用。

简短答案不可小觑

托福听力长对话的选择题型中可能出现四个选项都相对简短的答案，对这些答案要事先大致有个印象，它们往往会是时间，比值的问题。而出题位置和文章顺序基本一致。例如，如果出在第二题，则答案提示常在对话开头。如果听到相关内容，应该及时记录。这类题通常在对话提及的时间很短，容易发生漏听的现象。

有些同学会有只听托福听力，不做题目的方式备考，认为听力材料都听懂了，就没有问题了。其实这样做是有误区的，因为托福听力不是考查单纯翻译，在题目有也会玄机暗藏。很多时候，你认为你理解了，但是只有做了题目，才会发现你原来的理解并不到位。对题目的出题目的与题目理解的能力，也是托福听力的考查内容之一。托福听力的备选答案也偶有陷阱，可能会出现多个非错误答案，而此时则要求考生有能力辨别出哪个答案更贴切。

听、背比朗读更有帮助

托福备考中常会提及对于听力材料的反复诵读。这里所指的，并非拿来听力材料进行朗读。而更行之有效的方式是“听一句，原样复述；听几句，复述原意；听一段，概括大意”。这样，不仅锻炼了短期记忆从单词单句到长句复现的记忆过程，也提升了对内容理解与总结。

学习要有热情

兴趣与热情是学习中最好的动力。在听力中尝试去想象复原对话的真是场景，带入情景，这也会帮助考生更好的理解听力的内容与主题。学习态度在任何学习中都是成败因素。在学习热情与学习兴趣驱使下，你的留学之路才可能来得轻松些。

托福听力的备考重在掌握正确的方法与技巧并能持之以恒、不断练习。在托福听力的训练与学习中，不仅需要耐心，更需要有信心。

title: 托福听力备考提要

description:
Introducing a ground-breaking technique that seamlessly merges computer-generated and hand-drawn animation techniques, first-time director John Kahrs takes the art of animation in a bold new direction with the Oscar-nominated short, "Paperman."这是一次独创性的技术：将电脑生成和手绘动画天衣无缝的合二为一，第一次，导演约翰·卡尔斯的短话短片《纸人》以这种大胆新颖的动画形式夺得了奥斯卡提名（注：该片随后被评为第85届奥斯卡最佳动画短片）

Using a minimalist black-and-white style, the short follows the story of a lonely young man in mid-century New York City, whose destiny takes an unexpected turn after a chance meeting with a beautiful woman on his morning commute. Convinced the girl of his dreams is gone forever, he gets a second chance when he spots her in a skyscraper window across the avenue from his office.运用极简抽象派艺术的黑白风，这部短片讲述的是一个居住于中世纪纽约市的孤独年轻男子，在他通勤的一个早晨遇见了一个美丽的女子，随后他的命运发生了出乎意料的转折。本深信他日思夜想的女孩再也不会出现了，第二次，就在街道的对面，他从自己的办公室看到了对面摩天大楼窗口里那个女孩的身影。

With only his heart, imagination and a stack of papers to get her attention, his efforts are no match for what the fates have in store for him. Created by a small, innovative team working at Walt Disney Animation Studios, "Paperman" pushes the animation medium in an exciting new direction.他全心全意的，想象着，拿一堆文件想赢得她的注意，但是他的努力辜负了命运为他安排的邂逅。由迪士尼工作室一小支充满创意的团队制作的《纸人》，推动了动画媒介朝新的、令人兴奋的方向发展。

练习提示：这部影片全程没有台词，那我们要怎样通过这部片子学习英文呢？介绍大家一个好方法：通过观察片中人物的神态，揣摩他们的心情，以自己创造发散台词的形式“补完”这个关于爱的小故事。你可以把想到的对话写在纸上。这里给出例文一篇，大家对照着练习吧！

A LOVE STORY IN THOUGHTS
(jumbled sentences)
 
----- SCENE 1: at the platform --------------------------------
 
That's it, now she hates me... or maybe not?
What? She can't leave now! Just like that? Oh boy!
Oh no, stupid train, look what you've done!
She's laughing at me?
Should I say hello or something?
That girl's got something... Sweet!
Oops, I stained his form. Uhm... well... ha ha, so funny!
I think he likes me, he he, or does he not? Yeah, I think he does.
If only I could see him again...
Yea, definitely, very cute!
Was it a blush? I think it was! how sweet!
Ooh, look at him, he's cute!
I'm sleepy.
But he was so cute...
Mm? what's this?
But she was so cute...
Great, another wonderful day. Hate it.
lips mark? Ha, ha, love it, I'm gonna keep it.
It's no use girl, you're never going to make it.
I wish I could see her again. I think that was love at first sight.
Oh, Jenny, stop daydreaming, life's not like in the movies.
 
----- SCENE 2: at the office (until fat man) --------
 
Oh no, my sheet, her sheet!
Heeey!! it's me, remember? Yoohoo! Helloooo! Up here!!
I'm watching you boy.
Oops, that was close. Bloody wind.
What!!! Can it really be her!
Oh, I know! not this one. This.
what is wrong with this boy?
Like this... like this... ok, perfect! Here we go.
If only I could see her again! Why this always happens to me?
Ok, ok, I'll wait. After all, I'm always waiting. Always waiting.
Yea man, it's her! it's her! I can't believe it! If only she could see me.
Great. Life goes on, I guess.
Yes, yes, yes, yes!... Nope!
Ok, ok, and now what? How can I... Think, think.
Oops, the boss again!
Shut that freaking window up, you idiot! Man, what's wrong with him?
I say, what the hell is wrong with him?
Oops, there it goes. Pathetic.
Well, if you think I'm going to give up... I just got started!
Well, I just can't leave it at that. Think, think.
 
----- SCENE 3: in the office (starting with fat man) -----
 
Let me try again...
Oh, damn! I was so close!
Oh, to hell with birds!!
Oh, nice, how did this get here?
Here's your last chance boy, give me a good reason not to kick you out.
What? A weirdo! Is he trying to make fun of me or what?
Stay away from my forms.
To hell with it, run for it!
One more, one more.
Oh well, I guess that's it.
Just a little bit more to the right...
Oops, no more.
Ok, one last try... oh damn!
She's leav... you stay right there!
 
----- SCENE 4: In the street ----------------------------------
 
Oh, where have I seen this before?
Well, well, my cute handsome boy is back :)
Great! Why me? Why always me?
Great, now everybody thinks I'm a freak. Well, maybe I am, after all.
Let me out!!
Where is she, where is she? Where the hell is she gone?
These flowers look nice. I wish somebody bought me... Maybe that guy?
That boy...! If only I could find him again. If only he...
What? Get off! Leave me alone!
Ok, ok, I'll get in.
Wait!! Sorry, please, stop! Sorry, excuse me, sorry, this is important, sorry.
What? This is ridiculous! Stop it! What the hell is happening?
Ok little plane, why don't you tell me where he is?
What? my plane? her lips? Yea, great.
My cute little girl is back :)
Ok, got it, this is one of those days... hate it!
Oh my! Her!? Is this for real?
You trying to tell me something, little thing? wait! Come here!

title: 看片学英文 85届奥斯卡动画短片《纸人》

description:
Here are three tips, one for each part of the speaking test.下面有3个窍门，分别针对口语考试中的每个部分。

Part 1: stop and smile第一部分：停止与微笑

For part 1 of the speaking test, you need to get used to giving short answers. Many students find it difficult to stop speaking, and the examiner is forced to interrupt. My tip is to give your answer then stop and smile, showing the examiner that you are ready for the next question.在口语第一部分中，你要习惯简短回答。许多学生发现很难停住不说，然后考官不得不打断他们。我的诀窍是给出回答，停止，然后微笑，向考官表示你准备好回答下一题了。

Part 2: tell a story第二部分：讲故事

In the context of speaking part 2, a story is simply a long example to illustrate a point that you have made. If you’re describing a person, for example, you could tell a story to illustrate why you like him/her. People find it easy to keep speaking for longer when they have a story to tell.在第二部分中，故事是指用来说明你的观点的长例子。例如，如果你要描述一个人，你可以讲一个故事说明为什么你喜欢他/她。人们发现讲有故事可说时，很容易继续讲下去。

Part 3: include an ‘if...’ sentence第三部分：使用if条件句

Adding a conditional 'if...' sentence might help your grammar score.加入if条件句有助于提高你在语法方面的分数。
